text.0: may agni indra mitra varuṇa consent aryaman vāyu pūṣan and sarasvatī.
text.1: Ādityas maruts viṣṇu soma lofty sky rudra and aditi and brahmaṇaspati.
text.2: indra and agni herolords when vṛtra fell dwelling together speeding emulously on.
text.3: and soma blent with oil putting his greatness forth have with their power filled full the mighty firmament.
text.4: skilled in the law i lift the hymn of praise to these lawstrengtheners unassailed and great in majesty.
text.5: these in their wondrous bounty send the watery sea may they as kindly friends send gifts to make us great.
text.6: they with their might have stayed heaven earth and prthivi the lord of light the firmament the lustrous spheres.
text.7: even as fleetfoot steeds who make their masters glad the princely gods are praised most bountiful to man.
text.8: bring gifts to mitra and to varuṇa who lords of all in spirit never fail the worshipper.
text.9: whose statute shines on high through everlasting law whose places of sure refuge are the heavens and earth.
text.10: the cow who yielding milk goes her appointed way hither to us as leader of holy rites.
text.11: speaking aloud to varuṇa and the worshipper shall with oblation serve vivasvān and the gods.
text.12: the gods whose tongue is agni dwell in heaven and sit aiders of law reflecting in the seat of law.
text.13: they propped up heaven and then brought waters with their might got sacrifice and in a body made it fair.
text.14: born in the oldest time the parents dwelling round are sharers of one mansion in the home of law.
text.15: bound by their common vow dyaus prthivi stream forth the moisture rich in oil to varuṇa the steer.
text.16: parjanya vāta mighty senders of the rain indra and vāyu varuṇa mitra aryaman.
text.17: we call on aditi Ādityas and the gods those who are on the earth in waters and in heaven.
text.18: tvaṣṭar and vāyu those who count as Ṛbhus both celestial hotarpriests and dawn for happiness.
text.19: winners of wealth we call and wise bṛhaspati destroyer of our foes and soma indras friend.
text.20: they generated prayer the cow the horse the plants the forest trees the earth the waters and the hills.
text.21: these very bounteous gods made the sun mount to heaven and spread the righteous laws of Āryas oer the land.
text.22: o aśvins ye delivered bhujyu from distress ye animated Śyāva vadhrmatis son.
text.23: to vimada ye brought his consort kamadyu and gave his lost viṣṇāpū back to viśvaka.
text.24: thunder the lightnings daughter ajaekapād heavens bearer sindhu and the waters of the sea.
text.25: hear all the gods my words sarasvatī give ear together with purandhi and with holy thoughts.
text.26: with holy thoughts and with purandhi may all gods knowing the law immortal manus holy ones.
text.27: boongivers favourers finders of light and heaven with gracious love accept my songs my prayer my hymn.
text.28: immortal gods have i vasiṣṭha lauded gods set on high above all other beings.
text.29: may they this day grant us wide space and freedom ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
